paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on a KCNH2 variant associated with congenital long QT syndrome, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Marked QT prolongation, diagnosed with congenital long QT syndrome.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Genetic screening for long QT syndrome showed a previously unpublished class 4 nonsense variant in the KCNH2 gene, resulting in frameshift and protein truncation (NM_000238.3:c.2837delC).

individual_records.phenotype_details: Asymptomatic with borderline prolonged QTc of 460 ms.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: When segregation analysis was performed in family members, the patient’s daughter was identified as a carrier of the same genetic variant, with a borderline prolonged QTc of 460 ms.

functional_data.summary: The variant results in frameshift and protein truncation.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family; the daughter is a carrier but asymptomatic.
variants.additional_notes: The patient's father was screened and did not carry the variant.
key_quotes: Genetic screening for long QT syndrome showed a previously unpublished class 4 nonsense variant in the KCNH2 gene, resulting in frameshift and protein truncation (NM_000238.3:c.2837delC).
When segregation analysis was performed in family members, the patient’s daughter was identified as a carrier of the same genetic variant, with a borderline prolonged QTc of 460 ms.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
